title: Sterling & Wilson hives off data centre business, raises Rs 1,000 crore
description: Promoter Khurshed Daruvala and his family will own a 30% stake in the new data centre entity, Sterling & Wilson Data Center Pvt Ltd, while the rest will be held by investors.
content: Sterling & Wilson has hived off its data centre engineering and construction business into a separate entity and raised Rs 1,000 crore from promoter Khurshed Daruvala and other investors to execute its order book and fund overseas expansion.Daruvala and his family will own a 30% stake in the new data centre entity, Sterling & Wilson Data Center Pvt Ltd, while the rest will be held by investors including Ashish Kacholia, Lashit Sanghvi, Madhu Kela and Mukul Agarwal, people involved in the matter told ET. Sterling & Wilson, a Shapoorji Pallonji Group company, will not have any ownership of the new entity.“With the global data centre market expanding rapidly, it was essential to carve out this business into a dedicated entity, fully capitalised and singularly focused on growing our leadership position in this very exciting industry,” Sterling & Wilson chairman Daruvala said, confirming the creation of the new company.After a sale of the data centre business was announced in March 2024, the first six months of this year witnessed an order inflow of more than what was won in the past five years, he said. “What is extremely gratifying is that most of the orders have come from our repeat clients,” he told ET over email.The data centre EPC (engineering, procurement, construction) division was a 100% business unit of Sterling & Wilson. It was debt-free and profitable with revenue of Rs 460 crore. The new company was instituted last week after receiving all the approvals.
